div.p:
I got a notice
from the Lord Mayor
yesterday and have
written an acknow
ledgement to the
subscribers - committee
Honorary secretaries
and to his Lordship
for their kindness
which I understand
will appear in the
"Times". I feel deeply
grateful also to you
and the Geographers
who contributed
so liberally and
spent so much
time on it, but
I thought that I could
not specify you
without naming
"Wire" and others
for whom I entertain
no such feeling.
It is only a pity
that it was not
an affair of the
Geographers alone.

I don't yet see
my way clear to
going down to
Admiral Smythe's.
I am as busy as
I can be writing
new matter yet
but am near
Tete so will soon
get my head above
water and will
let you know. I would
like to see the Admiral
much. I must
bring the little girl soon
& then I shall
bring the grammar
to get Norris's opinion.
I must step up to
hear about Burton.
I have a letter from
a lady for him.
Aare you writing
him?. I am not
well, giddiness & head-
ache &c Yours Ever
